snippet: A commemorative euro coin with Christian imagery became the latest source of discord between the profoundly religious and those who prize a more rigid church-state divide.
abstract: Commemorative euro coin with Christian imagery has become latest source of discord in Europe Union between profoundly religious and those who prize more rigid church-state divide; at time when Europe needs solidarity and unified sense of purpose in face of economic crisis, religion is dividing mostly secular Western Europe from profoundly religious nations in east like Poland and those in between both in geography and in faith like Slovakia.
lead_paragraph: A commemorative euro coin with Christian imagery became the latest source of discord between the profoundly religious and those who prize a more rigid church-state divide.

headline.main: A More Secular Europe, Divided by the Cross
headline.print_headline: A More Secular Europe, Divided by the Cross
